roof material

Outline of entryway
floor area that counts
TWICE if entryway is
vaulted

Note: If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway
the area will be counted as follows:
• In this example, a portion of the entryway is recessed
beyond the house facade and roof. It is included in the
area that counts.
• The area is measured to the outside material of the entry-
way feature.
• The area counts TWICE toward gross floor area.

12

visual_elements.description: Three-view architectural drawing showing an entry feature with gabled roof. Includes isometric view (3D perspective), side elevation (profile view), and porch floor plan (top-down view). The isometric view shows a house with a protruding entry feature with gabled roof, windows, and dimensional arrows indicating height and grade measurements. The side elevation shows the same feature in profile with height and grade measurements marked. The porch floor plan shows the outline of the entryway roof and floor area with annotations.

structural_elements.main_heading: Fig 7 Entry feature with gabled roof

additional_notes: Page appears to be from a technical manual with clear architectural drawings and measurement annotations
cross_references: Reference to gross floor area calculation methodology

qualifiers.text: If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway

conditions.text: a portion of the entryway is recessed beyond the house facade and roof
The area is measured to the outside material of the entryway feature
The area counts TWICE toward gross floor area

logical_relationships.expression: If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway the area will be counted as follows

execution_sequence.action: Determine if entryway qualifies as vaulted entryway
Include recessed portion beyond house facade and roof in area calculation
Measure area to outside material of entryway feature
Apply double counting toward gross floor area
